error.regex: dial tcp.*i/o timeout|dial tcp.*connect: connection timed out|net\.Dialer.*timeout

verdict.summary: TCP connection attempt timed out. The remote host is unreachable — firewall blocking, wrong IP/port, service not running, or network routing issues.

dead_ends.action: Set an extremely long dial timeout
dead_ends.why_fails: If the host is truly unreachable (firewall, wrong IP), no timeout duration will help — the connection will never succeed
dead_ends.condition: when the host is behind a firewall that drops packets

workarounds.action: Verify the target host and port are correct and reachable
workarounds.how: Use 'nc -zv host port' or 'telnet host port' from the same machine to verify connectivity independently of Go.

workarounds.action: Use net.Dialer with a reasonable timeout and retry logic

leads_to.condition: when TCP connects but TLS negotiation fails
when dial timeout causes the parent context to expire

preceded_by.condition: when connection refused changes to timeout due to firewall rule changes

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'i/o timeout' means packets are dropped (no response from host), while 'connection refused' means the host actively rejected the connection (RST packet received).
